pageContext.claim: “This should have been done ten years, 15, 20 years ago. This shouldn't be done now when they have an arsenal of nuclear weapons. They should have never allowed to get to this point.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is unusually ungracious to his predecessors, especially considering he has only just embarked on negotiations. Bill Clinton negotiated a nuclear agreement with North Korea that froze its plutonium program and was working on a missile deal when he departed office. But that agreement fell apart under George W. Bush. But then Bush tried to negotiate a deal, even lifting sanctions on North Korea. But that deal fell apart once Obama was elected. In each case, North Korea used the arrival of a new president to wiggle out of its commitments.
